snippet: Shirley L. Huntley, a former New York legislator, told other elected officials she had broken her ankle, then recorded them at her home in an effort to help her own corruption case.
abstract: Former New York legislator Shirley L Huntley secretly recorded other elected officials in her home in Jamaica, Queens, in effort to help her own corruption case; Huntley told investigators that she believed some of her fellow public officials were also corrupt, and now federal judge has unsealed list of officials that she recorded.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN, WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and MOSI SECRET
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan reported from Albany, and William K. Rashbaum and Mosi Secret from New York. Danny Hakim contributed reporting from Albany, and Nate Schweber from New York.

lead_paragraph: Shirley L. Huntley, a former New York legislator, told other elected officials she had broken her ankle, then recorded them at her home in an effort to help her own corruption case.

headline.seo: Court Names Officials Recorded in Corruption Inquiry
headline.main:
For Officials on
Tape, Legislator’s
Invitation Was Ruse
headline.print_headline: State Senator Covertly Taped 7 at Her Home

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
